title: Spoon, ca. 1600–30
markings: On inside of spoonbowl: "N" in a round shape, partly overstruck by a maker's mark of crowned shield (inside of shield obscured).
provenance: The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection; gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg; 1985: acquired by Museum
creditline: The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection, gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg
description: Oval spoon bowl, gilded neck elaborately decorated with leaves, masks and scrollwork. Slightly curving handle of red coral, carved with a grotesque head on the front, above the upper body of a woman holding a ewer in one hand and an urn in the other, as if pouring liquid from one into the other. Back of handle has decorative pattern.

tombstone.epitaph:
Spoon, ca. 1600–30.
ca. 1600–30. Coral, gilt silver. The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection, gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg. 1985-103-82.
